intro: Veronica sibirica f. zuccarinii, commonly known as the Zuccarinii speedwell, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the cold regions of Siberia and Central Asia. It features small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. The plant has a mat-forming habit, with slender stems and small, ovate leaves covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a hardy and resilient species suitable for rock gardens and alpine displays.
